text: [music playing]

KELLY BOWMAN: From
the ocean floor

to the top of the
majestic Pitons,

from steaming volcanoes
and sulphur springs,

to lush, dense
rainforests, St. Lucia

is an island easily as
rich in natural wonders

as it is in luxury
accommodations.

ANDRE BOERSMA: The
first thing our guests
see are these iconic Pitons.

Once they come down
through the entrance,

they're surrounded by tropical
rain forest, lush greenery,
beautiful flowers, fruit trees.

They're just enthralled
by what they see.

KELLY BOWMAN: Sugar Beach is
an exclusive five star resort

nestled between the two
impressive volcanic Pitons
on St. Lucia's west coast.

ANDRE BOERSMA: We are
in just under 200 acres.

Our villas, which are dotted
throughout the hillside

overseeing the Caribbean
Sea and the Pitons,

all have their
private plunge pools.

Most of them are stand alone,
so they're very private.

We try to offer
all of our guests

a very exclusive,
personalized experience here.

Right from the get
go, our guests go
right to their accommodations.

The checking is done there
by their personal butler.

KELLY BOWMAN: In
addition to a 24 hour

personal butler who is there
to meet your every need--
- Good afternoon.

KELLY BOWMAN: Another
luxury guests can enjoy
is the rainforest spa.

ANDRE BOERSMA: The
design is very unique.
It's inside a rainforest.

And that's what's so fun about
actually the whole property.

We have a steam bath that
has been built in there.

A little creek that
flows through that

actually forms part
of the treatments
that we offer for our guests.

KELLY BOWMAN: After
relaxing at the spa,
you'll want a bite to eat.

ANDRE BOERSMA: I tell
guests that I can guarantee

them at least seven
different evening
dining experiences in a week.

Jacques Chretien is well
known throughout the culinary
industry, very well respected.

And he's the one that's
been able to pull all

the different offerings together
to make it an amazing culinary
experience for our guests.

KELLY BOWMAN: While
you'll find everything

you need at the resort,
Sugar Beach makes sure guests
truly experience the island.

ANDRE BOERSMA: The team
here at Sugar Beach really

sets us apart with their
genuine hospitality.

They love to share the history,
the culture with our guests.

There is so much to
see in St. Lucia.

KELLY BOWMAN: Like the views
of the island from your
private deep sea fishing boat.

ANDEL JOYEUX: You go out
there and you could view
the entire island differently.

We have the experience,
the equipment.

We have the boats and
the knowledge of where
are the best fishing grounds.

With fishing, there's lots of
excitement, lots of adventure.

We go out, and
anything could happen.

KELLY BOWMAN: The adventure
awaits for individuals
or groups up to eight people.

You can also add snorkeling
or whale and dolphin watching
for a truly customized trip.

Once you've experienced
the sand and the sea,

head high into the
rain forest canopy.

And for those
million dollar views,

try out a ziplining course
at Rainforest Adventures.

BARBARA LOUIS: We're
located in the oldest rain
forest reserve in St. Lucia.

You swing from one
platform for the next.
You do some brief walks between.

You are with the guide to
explain the nature to you.

So you're having a little bit
knowledge of our rainforest,

and you get to do the fun and
the sporting activity as well.

KELLY BOWMAN: If swinging
isn't your style,

you can still take
in spectacular views
from the open air gondola.

BARBARA LOUIS: The tour
guide gives explanation about
the fauna and flora around you.

And then you come back via
the canopy above the trees.

And again, beautiful
scenery of the rainforest
and of the north of the island.

KELLY BOWMAN: Whichever
experience you choose, you're

sure to leave with an
appreciation of the island,

and you can't put
a price on that.

BARBARA LOUIS: You are within
endless shades of green.

The air is constantly changing
from this fresh feel of the air
from the plants, from the trees.

You hear the sounds
from the birds.
It's never still.

A lot of our visitors
feel very relaxed.
It's being one with nature.

KELLY BOWMAN: Kelly
Bowman, CNN, St. Lucia.
